edu.arizona.biosemantics.semanticmarkup.ling.normalize.lib

Class CharacterListNormalizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.arizona.biosemantics.semanticmarkup.ling.normalize.lib.CharacterListNormalizer

  • public class CharacterListNormalizer
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Hong Cui turn "brown to black" to "coloration~list~brown~to~black" this is a singleton class

      private void normalizeCharacterLists(java.lang.String list, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> chunkedTokens)
      connect a list of character states of the same character together, for example: keeled , elliptic to broadly ovate to shape~list~keeled~punct~elliptic~to~broadly~ovate example 2: not keeled , elliptic to broadly ovate to shape~list~not~keeled~punct~elliptic~to~broadly~ovate //"rarely" will be treated the same way as "not" example 3: not keeled or ovate to shape~list~not~keeled~or~ovate //because of "or", the modifer needs to be applied to all states in the or-list return updated string in format of {shape~list~elliptic~to~broadly~ovate}

      • lookupCharacters

                                                       boolean markadv)
        populate charactertokensReversed with a character representation of the str, in reversed token order. str: <blades> {lance-ovate} to {narrowly} {lanceolate} . return: . shape narrowly ` shape #
        Parameters:
        str -
        markadv -

      • normalizeCharacterLists

        private void normalizeCharacterLists(java.lang.String list,
                                     java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> chunkedTokens)
        connect a list of character states of the same character together, for example: keeled , elliptic to broadly ovate to shape~list~keeled~punct~elliptic~to~broadly~ovate example 2: not keeled , elliptic to broadly ovate to shape~list~not~keeled~punct~elliptic~to~broadly~ovate //"rarely" will be treated the same way as "not" example 3: not keeled or ovate to shape~list~not~keeled~or~ovate //because of "or", the modifer needs to be applied to all states in the or-list return updated string in format of {shape~list~elliptic~to~broadly~ovate}

        when "to"[@] is the last token in bracketed phrase: e.g. (, {yellow-gray}, to, ), {coloration~list~brown~to~black}
        Parameters:
        inlist: - & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & coloration @ & & & & & & & &
        startindex -
        chunkedTokens -
        Returns:
        first indexof such "@" as a word after startindex

      • hasModifiedStructure

        private boolean hasModifiedStructure(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> characterTokensReversed)
        a test used to see if a postion term should be converted to a structure term if the position term hasModifiedStructure, then it should not be converted Scan through charactertokensReversed from back to front
        Parameters:
        characterTokensReversed - "# color position"
        Returns:
        true: e.g., "with {medial} {red} <bloth>": {medial} should stay as position false: "or {outer} smaller ," {outer} should be converted to <outer>
